intro: Crotalaria bongensis, commonly known as the Bongensis Cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, making it valuable in soil enrichment. Crotalaria bongensis typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are used in traditional medicine in some African countries.
